PolicyCodingNotes: Public Health Emergency declared, in effect for 60 days (i.e., to 20200512). Extended to 20210308: https://governor.alabama.gov/newsroom/2020/12/twentieth-supplemental-state-of-emergency-coronavirus-covid-19/. Extended to 20210507: https://governor.alabama.gov/assets/2021/03/2021-03-04-23rd-Supplemental-SOE-COVID-19.pdf Extended to 20210706 https://governor.alabama.gov/newsroom/2021/05/twenty-seventh-supplemental-state-of-emergency-coronavirus-covid-19/ Ended public health emergency at 1159 pm on 20210706, so coding as 20210707 https://governor.alabama.gov/newsroom/2021/07/termination-of-state-of-emergency-coronavirus-covid-19/

Issued orally on 20200313, this requires the closure of all K-12 public schools at the end of day 20200318 (coded to 20200319 when enacted), with re-opening on 20200406 should circumstances permit    https://governor.alabama.gov/assets/2020/03/2020-03-18-1st-Supplemental-COVID-19-SOE.pdf On 20200320, all public and private schools (elementary, secondary, postsecondary, technical, colleges and universities) must close for in-person instruction: https://www.alabamapublichealth.gov/legal/assets/order-adph-cov-gatherings-031920.pdf Starting on 20200601, state-level restrictions end, now allowing schools re-open as long as reasonable efforts are taken to maintain at least 6 ft distancing: https://www.alabamapublichealth.gov/legal/assets/order-adph-cov-gatherings-052120.pdf

Public health order prohibits on-premises consumption at bars and breweries for one week at 20200317, but take-out and delivery permitted. Only applicable in Blount, Saint Clair, Shelby, Tuscaloosa, and Walker Counties
Public health order for prohibiting gathering restrictions of 25 or more in Blount, Saint Clair, Shelby, Tuscaloosa, and Walker Counties. In effect for the duration of the public health emergency

Public health order prohibits on-premises consumption of food or drink in restaurants for one week at 20200317, but take-out and delivery permitted. Only applicable in Blount, Saint Clair, Shelby, Tuscaloosa, and Walker Counties

No on-premises consumption of food or drink at bars, and breweries. Take-out, delivery, curbside pickup all permitted if social distancing protocols are followed. Expands to statewide bar restrictions. Eased on 20200511: https://www.alabamapublichealth.gov/legal/assets/order-adph-cov-gatherings-050820.pdf
Expands public health order to limit gatherings to no more than 25 to be statewide

All beaches close effective at 5 pm 20200319. Extended to 20200831 https://governor.alabama.gov/assets/2020/07/2020-07-29-15th-Supplemental-SOE-COVID-19.pdf Eased to permit re-opening on 20200430: https://www.alabamapublichealth.gov/legal/assets/order-adph-cov-gatherings-042820.pdf

No on-premises consumption of food or drink permitted in restaurants. Take-out, delivery, curbside pickup all permitted if social distancing protocols are followed. Expands to statewide restaurant restrictions. Eases on 20200511: https://www.alabamapublichealth.gov/legal/assets/order-adph-cov-gatherings-050820.pdf

Expands restriction gathering to 10 or more people being prohibited. Eased to any gathering restriction starting 20200511 https://www.alabamapublichealth.gov/legal/assets/order-adph-cov-gatherings-050820.pdf

Closes the following non-essential business venues (with specific businesses in parentheses): entertainment venues (i.e., Night clubs, Bowling alleys, Arcades, Concert venues, Theaters, auditoriums, and performing arts centers, Tourist attractions (including museums and planetariums), Racetracks, Indoor childrens play areas, Adult entertainment venues, Casinos, Bingo halls, Venues operated by social clubs), athletic facilities and activities (i.e., Fitness centers and commercial gyms, Spas and public or commercial swimming pools, Yoga, barre, and spin facilities, Spectator sports, Sports that involve interaction with another person of closer than 6 feet, Activities that require use of shared sporting apparatus and equipment, Activities on commercial or public playground equipment), close contact service provides (i.e., Barber shops, Hair salons, Waxing salons, Threading salons, Nail salons and spas, Body-art facilities and tattoo services, Tanning salons, Massage-therapy establishments and massage services), and specific retail stores (i.e., Furniture and home-furnishings stores, Clothing, shoe, and clothing-accessory stores, Jewelry, luggage, and leather goods stores, Department stores, Sporting goods stores, Book, craft, and music stores). Not coding as a non-essential business closure given list of sectors (rather than a broader closure of all non-essential businesses and listing exceptions). Easing started on 20200430, allowing retail stores to reopen: https://www.alabamapublichealth.gov/legal/assets/order-adph-cov-gatherings-042820.pdf All businesses closed by this order are permitted to reopen as of 20200522: https://www.alabamapublichealth.gov/legal/assets/order-adph-cov-gatherings-052120.pdf

Anyone who tests positive for COVID-19 shall be quarantined in their place of residence for a period of 14 days, or other period of time as directed by the State Health Officer, after receiving positive results. Technically eased on 20200827, removing the 14-day requirement and deferring to time directed by the State Health Officer: https://governor.alabama.gov/newsroom/2020/08/seventeenth-supplemental-state-of-emergency-coronavirus-covid-19/ Extended to 20210122: https://governor.alabama.gov/newsroom/2020/12/twentieth-supplemental-state-of-emergency-coronavirus-covid-19/. Extended to 20210305 https://www.alabamapublichealth.gov/legal/assets/order-adph-cov-gatherings-012121.pdf. Extended to 20210409: https://governor.alabama.gov/assets/2021/03/2021-03-04-23rd-Supplemental-SOE-COVID-19.pdf. Extended to 20210505: https://governor.alabama.gov/assets/2021/04/2021-04-07-26th-Supplemental-SOE-COVID-19.pdf. Extended to 20210601 https://www.alabamapublichealth.gov/legal/assets/order-adph-cov-safer-apart-050321.pdf Ended on 20210601 https://governor.alabama.gov/newsroom/2021/05/governor-ivey-announces-covid-19-public-health-order-and-state-of-emergency-to-end/

(quote) every person is ordered to stay at his or her place of residence except as necessary to perform any of the following (quote) essential activities (quote) (quote). Effective at 500 pm on 20200404. Ends on 20200430: https://www.alabamapublichealth.gov/legal/assets/order-adph-cov-gatherings-042820.pdf

Allows for beaches to open to gatherings of 10 or fewer people, and anyone using beaches as to keep 6 ft distance or more. Coding as OutdoorOnly under BusinessRestrictLevel as this policy appears to permit beach useage but does not expressly allow indoor services at beaches to re-open. Further eases on 20200511, now only requring 6 ft distancing: https://www.alabamapublichealth.gov/legal/assets/order-adph-cov-gatherings-050820.pdf Extends to 20210122: https://governor.alabama.gov/assets/2020/11/2020-11-05-19th-Supplemental-SOE-COVID-19.pdf. Extended to 20210305 https://www.alabamapublichealth.gov/legal/assets/order-adph-cov-gatherings-012121.pdf. Extended to 20210409: https://governor.alabama.gov/assets/2021/03/2021-03-04-23rd-Supplemental-SOE-COVID-19.pdf. Ended on 20210409 with conversion of state mandates to recommendations: https://governor.alabama.gov/assets/2021/04/2021-04-07-26th-Supplemental-SOE-COVID-19.pdf.

Allows for in-person services for retail businesses if they are at 50 percent or lower capacity, ensure at least 6 ft distancing between customers, and enact sanitation and disinfection protocols. Further eased on 20201108, removing 50 pct capacity limit: https://governor.alabama.gov/assets/2020/11/2020-11-05-19th-Supplemental-SOE-COVID-19.pdf. Extended to 20210305 https://www.alabamapublichealth.gov/legal/assets/order-adph-cov-gatherings-012121.pdf. https://governor.alabama.gov/assets/2021/04/2021-04-07-26th-Supplemental-SOE-COVID-19.pdf.
Encourages people to wear face coverings around people from other households when it is necessary to leave the home

Continues recommendation for all individuals, especially vulnerable persons, to minimize travel outside the home. Extended to 20200831 https://governor.alabama.gov/assets/2020/07/2020-07-29-15th-Supplemental-SOE-COVID-19.pdf Extended to 20201002 https://governor.alabama.gov/newsroom/2020/08/seventeenth-supplemental-state-of-emergency-coronavirus-covid-19/. Eases bar and brewery restrictions such that on-premises consumption can happen, but party size must be limited to no more than 8 people and maintain at least 6 ft separation, employees must wear masks or facial coverings, and no self-serve services. Also encouraged to follow restaurant and bar guidelines https://alabamapublichealth.gov/covid19/assets/cov-sah-restaurants-bars.pdf Further eased on 20200831, allowing self-service drink stations to reopen: https://governor.alabama.gov/newsroom/2020/08/seventeenth-supplemental-state-of-emergency-coronavirus-covid-19/ Extended to 20210122: https://governor.alabama.gov/newsroom/2020/12/twentieth-supplemental-state-of-emergency-coronavirus-covid-19/. Extended to 20210305 https://www.alabamapublichealth.gov/legal/assets/order-adph-cov-gatherings-012121.pdf. Further eased on 20210306 to remove party size limits, so long as parties maintain six feet distance: https://governor.alabama.gov/assets/2021/03/2021-03-04-23rd-Supplemental-SOE-COVID-19.pdf. Ended on 20210409 with conversion of state mandates to recommendations: 
https://governor.alabama.gov/assets/2021/04/2021-04-07-26th-Supplemental-SOE-COVID-19.pdf.

Requires that employees wear a mask or facial covering when interacting with customers and clients at the following businesses: close contact personal care services, athletic facilities, restaurants and bars. On 20200716, expanded more broadly with statewide mask mandate: https://governor.alabama.gov/assets/2020/07/Safer-at-Home-Order-Mask-Amendment-7.15.2020-FINAL.pdf Extended to 20210122: https://governor.alabama.gov/newsroom/2020/12/twentieth-supplemental-state-of-emergency-coronavirus-covid-19/. https://governor.alabama.gov/assets/2021/04/2021-04-07-26th-Supplemental-SOE-COVID-19.pdf.

Eases restrictions gathering restrictions, now only requiring that all non-work related gatherings that cannot maintain a consistent 6 ft distance between persons from different households as being prohibited. Religious gatherings are strongly encouraged to follow places of worship guidelines https://www.alabamapublichealth.gov/covid19/assets/cov-sah-worship.pdf Extended to 20210122: https://governor.alabama.gov/newsroom/2020/12/twentieth-supplemental-state-of-emergency-coronavirus-covid-19/. Eases restaurant restrictions such that on-premises consumption can happen, but party size must be limited to no more than 8 people and maintain at least 6 ft separation, employees must wear masks or facial coverings, and no self-serve services (eg buffets). Also encouraged to follow restaurant and bar guidelines https://alabamapublichealth.gov/covid19/assets/cov-sah-restaurants-bars.pdf Somewhat eases on 20200831, allowing for self-services to resume: https://governor.alabama.gov/newsroom/2020/08/seventeenth-supplemental-state-of-emergency-coronavirus-covid-19/ Extends to 20210122: https://governor.alabama.gov/newsroom/2020/12/twentieth-supplemental-state-of-emergency-coronavirus-covid-19/. https://governor.alabama.gov/assets/2021/04/2021-04-07-26th-Supplemental-SOE-COVID-19.pdf.

Eases restrictions on entertainment venues, permitting them to re-open at no more than 50 pct capacity, comply with at least 6 ft distancing among patrons, santitation protocols. Athletic activities previously prohibited, such as team sports practices, are permitted to resume as of 20200522 as well, conditional on following proper social distancing (at least 6 ft distancing, sanitation, etc). Eased on 20201108, removing 50 pct capacity limits for entertainment venues: https://governor.alabama.gov/assets/2020/11/2020-11-05-19th-Supplemental-SOE-COVID-19.pdf Extended to 20210122: https://governor.alabama.gov/newsroom/2020/12/twentieth-supplemental-state-of-emergency-coronavirus-covid-19/. (quote) Employees shall, to the greatest extent practicable, wear a mask or other facial covering that covers his or her nostrils and mouth at all times when in regular interaction within six feet of a person from a different household (quote). Does not require students to wear masks at this time. On 20200716, expands mandate to apply to schools more broadly: https://governor.alabama.gov/assets/2020/07/Safer-at-Home-Order-Mask-Amendment-7.15.2020-FINAL.pdf Extended to 20210122: https://governor.alabama.gov/newsroom/2020/12/twentieth-supplemental-state-of-emergency-coronavirus-covid-19/. https://governor.alabama.gov/assets/2021/04/2021-04-07-26th-Supplemental-SOE-COVID-19.pdf.

Mandates that all Alabamans wear a mask when in an indoor space open to the general public (and where 6 ft distancing is not possible), a vehicle operated by a transportation service, or an outdoor public space where ten or more people are gathered. Exceptions for people under six or who are medically unable to wear a mask. Coded as Mandate2 because although masks are required in both indoor and outdoor spaces, the parameters on the spaces involved are relatively narrow (for instance, masks are only required in outdoor spaces if ten or more people are present). Extended to 20200831 https://governor.alabama.gov/assets/2020/07/2020-07-29-15th-Supplemental-SOE-COVID-19.pdf Extended to 20201002 https://governor.alabama.gov/newsroom/2020/08/seventeenth-supplemental-state-of-emergency-coronavirus-covid-19/.
