PolicyCodingNotes: Eases restaurant restrictions to allow outdoor service. Restrictions on in-door service is still in place. Must ensure 6 feet can be maintained between tables, not to exceed 50 people.

Eases bar restrictions to allow indoor service at 50 pct capacity up to 250 people. Extended to 20200714: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2020-75%20Extension%20of%20PTE_tcm1055-435771.pdf. Extended to 20200813: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2020-78%20Final_tcm1055-440367.pdf. Extended to 20200912: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2020-83%20Final_tcm1055-443546.pdf. Extended to 20201013: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2020-89%20%28002%29_tcm1055-446168.pdf. Extended to 20201113: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2020-92%20Seventh%20Extension%20of%20PTE%20Filed%20%28002%29_tcm1055-449844.pdf.

Extends gathering restrictions of more than 10 persons indoors, eases to 25 for outdoor gatherings. Extends eased restrictions on gatherings of 10 or more for places of worship, funeral homes, and other venues that offer gathering space for weddings, funerals, or planned services of worship. Indoor settings cannot have more than 25 percent normal capacity with a maximum of 250 people with adherence to physical distancing. Outdoor settings must not exceed 250 individuals.

Eases restrictions on previously closed businesses, permitting them to re-open only in accordance with the Stay Safe Minnesota guidelines (i.e., 25 pct capacity for gyms, personal fitness and yoga studios, indoor and outdoor entertainment venues like theaters and concert halls, indoor entertainment venues such as bowling alleys, arcades, museums, arcades. Original Stay Safe Minnesota guidance is no longer available but original 25 pct capacity requirements are listed in news article: https://ccxmedia.org/news/mn-governor-walz-announces-re-opening-of-indoor-dining-gyms-entertainment-venues/

Eases restaurant restrictions to allow indoor service at 50 pct capacity up to 250 people. Extended to 20200714: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2020-75%20Extension%20of%20PTE_tcm1055-435771.pdf. Extended to 20200813: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2020-78%20Final_tcm1055-440367.pdf. Extended to 20200912: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2020-83%20Final_tcm1055-443546.pdf. Extended to 20201013: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2020-89%20%28002%29_tcm1055-446168.pdf. Extended to 20201113: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2020-92%20Seventh%20Extension%20of%20PTE%20Filed%20%28002%29_tcm1055-449844.pdf.

Minnesotans are required to wear a face covering (quote) in an indoor business or public indoor space, including when waiting outdoors to enter an indoor business or public indoor space, and when riding on public transportation, in a taxi, in a ride-sharing vehicle, or in a vehicle that is being used for business purposes (quote). Strongly encourages the use of face coverings in indoor and outdoor social gatherings, when riding in a private vehicle with others who are not in the same household, when participating in sporting events, and when outdoors in a public business or outdoor space where physical distancing is not possible. Coded as a Mandate2 for PublicMaskLevel as it covers multiple sectors but is limited to indoors. Coded to going into effect on 20200725. Extended to 20210111 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2020-103%20Final%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-458627.pdf. Extended on 20210106 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/Executive%20Order%2021-01%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-462272.pdf. No expiry specified, tied to emergency declaration. PolicyCodingNotes: Kindergarten through grade 12 schools must comply with face covering and face shield guidance available at https://www.health.state.mn.us/diseases/coronavirus/schools/k12planguide.pdf. (quote) In general, unless the individual is exempt under paragraph 8.a or .c of this Executive Order or is under the age of two, all students, staff, and other persons present indoors in school buildings and district offices or riding on school transportation vehicles are required to wear a face covering. (quote) Extended to 20210111 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2020-103%20Final%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-458627.pdf. Extended on 20210106 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/Executive%20Order%2021-01%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-462272.pdf. No expiry specified. Extended to 20210213 with extension of emergency declaration: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-04%20Final_tcm1055-463085.pdf. Extended to 20210316: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-08%20Final%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-468348.pdf. Extended to 20210415: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-12_tcm1055-472035.pdf. Extended to 20210515 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-19%20Final%20%28003%29_tcm1055-476482.pdf Extended to 20210613 https://www.lrl.mn.gov/archive/execorders/21-22.pdf Ended on 20210614 per previous order

Expands bar restrictions and includes business curfew limits. Occupancy must not exceed 50 pct or 150 people (was previously 250 people) provided that physical distancing of 6 feet is maintained between parties seated at different tables. (quote) For establishments that offer outdoor seating, the combined total occupancy of all indoor and outdoor spaces must not exceed 150 people. All establishments must close and remain closed each day for on premises consumption between the hours of 10:00 p.m. and 4:00 a.m. (quote) . Extends to 20201215: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2020-97%20Final_tcm1055-453622.pdf.

Expands gathering restrictions. (quote) All social gatherings of more than 10 people and all social gatherings involving members of more than 3 households (regardless of the size of the gathering) people are prohibited. (quote)

Expands restaurant restrictions and includes business curfew limits. Occupancy must not exceed 50 pct or 150 people (was previously 250 people) provided that physical distancing of 6 feet is maintained between parties seated at different tables. (quote) For establishments that offer outdoor seating, the combined total occupancy of all indoor and outdoor spaces must not exceed 150 people. All establishments must close and remain closed each day for on premises consumption between the hours of 10:00 p.m. and 4:00 a.m. (quote) . Extends to 20201215: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2020-97%20Final_tcm1055-453622.pdf.
Expands bar restrictions, closing on-premises services and requiring takeaway, delivery, drive-through only

Expands prior gathering restriction, (quote) Except as specifically permitted in this Executive Order, social gatherings are prohibited. Social gatherings are groups of individuals, who are not members of the same household, congregated together for a common or coordinated social, community, or leisure purpose—even if social distancing can be maintained (quote) Religious gatherings are limited to no more than 50 pct indoors (maximum of 250 people) and no more than 250 people outdoors (no capacity limit)

Expands restrictions on the following, limiting activities and use only to outdoor services for outdoor recreational establishments. Applicable to the following businesses: all state parks, public and private marinas, public and private golf courses and driving ranges, off-highway vehicle, snowmobiles, and watercraft repair shops, facilities, and showrooms, bait shops, outdoor shooting ranges and game farms, ski areas. Also permits outdoor recreational equipment rentals, dispersed or single campsites, outdoor competitions, etc. Extended to 20210111 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2020-103%20Final%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-458627.pdf

Requires closure of the following: gymnasiums, fitness centers, recreation centers, indoor sports facilities, indoor climbing facilities, trampoline parks, indoor and outdoor exercise facilities, martial arts facilities, and dance and exercise studios, venues providing indoor events and entertainment such as theaters, cinemas, concert halls, festivals, fairs, vendor fairs, museums, performance venues, stadiums, arcades, and bowling alleys, venues providing outdoor events and entertainment such as paintball, go-karts, mini-golf, performance venues, festivals, fairs, vendor fairs, and amusement parks. Also requires closure of racetracks. On 20201219, extends closures for venues providing indoor events and entertainment such as theaters, cinemas, concert halls, festivals, fairs, vendor fairs, museums, performance venues, stadiums, arcades, and bowling alleys. https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2020-103%20Final%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-458627.pdf
LastUpdatedNotes: Added DateEased, updated DateExpiry and PolicyCodingNotes

PolicyCodingNotes: (quote) Persons arriving in Minnesota from other states or countries, including returning Minnesota residents, are strongly encouraged to practice self-quarantine for 14 days after arrival by limiting their interactions to their immediate household (quote). Extended to 20210111 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2020-103%20Final%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-458627.pdf Extended to 20210114 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/Executive%20Order%2021-01%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-462272.pdf Extended to 20210213 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-04%20Final_tcm1055-463085.pdf Extended to 20210316 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-08%20Final%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-468348.pdf Extended to 20210316 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-11%20Final_tcm1055-471550.pdf  Eased on 20210315, allowing those who have fully recovered from COVID to be exempt from quarantine recommendation. (quote) Persons arriving in Minnesota from other states or countries, including returning Minnesota residents, are strongly encouraged to follow the recommendations in MDHs Quarantine Guidance (https://www.health.state.mn.us/diseases/coronavirus/quarguide.pdf). (quote). MDH Quarantine Guidance now states that those who are fully vaccinated do not need to quarantine. Extended to 20210415 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-12_tcm1055-472035.pdf Extended to 20210515 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-19%20Final%20%28003%29_tcm1055-476482.pdf Extended to 20210613 https://www.lrl.mn.gov/archive/execorders/21-22.pdf Ended on 20210528 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/Signed%20Final%20EO-21-21%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-480440.pdf

PolicyCodingNotes: Expands restaurant and like venues restrictions, closing on-premises services and requiring takeaway, delivery, drive-through only

Eases bars restrictions to allow outdoor service. Must ensure 6 feet can be maintained between tables, not to exceed 50 pct capacity with a maximum of 100 people in total at establishments, and workers and customers must follow face covering requirements set forth by DEED. All establishments must close and remain closed each day for outdoor on-premises consumption between the hours of 10:00 pm and 4:00 am.

Eases gathering restrictions. (quote) Indoor social gatherings involving not more than two households, up to a maximum of 10 people, are permitted as long as members of different households maintain at least six feet of separation from each other.... Outdoor social gatherings involving not more than three households, up to a maximum of 15 people, are permitted as long as members of different households maintain at least six feet of separation from each other (quote).

Eases restrictions on gymnasiums, fitness centers, recreation centers, indoor sports facilities, indoor climbing facilities, indoor and outdoor exercise facilities, martial arts facilities, and dance and exercise studios, and venues providing outdoor events, such as paintball, go-karts, mini-golf, performance venues, festivals, fairs, vendor fairs, and amusement parks, allowing for individual exercise with the following guidelines: cannot exceed 25 pct occupancy, with a max of 100 people. Further eased on 20210106 to allow a max of 150 people (still 25 pct capacity). Extended to 20210213 with extension of emergency declaration: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-04%20Final_tcm1055-463085.pdf. Further eased on 20210213 for gyms, fitness centers, and like venues, now allowing up to 250 people or 25 pct capacity. Extended to 20210316: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-08%20Final%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-468348.pdf. Eased on 20210315 to permit up to 50 pct capacity, and beginning 20210401 venues with adequate capacity may exceed the 250-person limit using the online venue occupancy calculator: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-11%20Final_tcm1055-471550.pdf. Extended to 20210415: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-12_tcm1055-472035.pdf. Extended to 20210515 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-19%20Final%20%28003%29_tcm1055-476482.pdf Further eased on 20210507 to remove capacity and numerical limits outdoors and remove numerical limits indoors https://mn.gov/governor/assets/Signed%20Final%20EO-21-21%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-480440.pdf Extended to 20210613 https://www.lrl.mn.gov/archive/execorders/21-22.pdf Ended on 20210528 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/Signed%20Final%20EO-21-21%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-480440.pdf
LastUpdatedNotes: Updated PolicyCodingNotes and DateExpiry and Added DateEnded

PolicyCodingNotes: Eases restaurant restrictions to allow outdoor service. Must ensure 6 feet can be maintained between tables, not to exceed 50 pct capacity with a maximum of 100 people in total at establishments, and workers and customers must follow face covering requirements set forth by DEED. All establishments must close and remain closed each day for outdoor on-premises consumption between the hours of 10:00 pm and 4:00 am.

Eases bars restrictions to allow indoor service. Must ensure 6 feet can be maintained between tables, not to exceed 50 pct capacity with a maximum of 150 people in total for indoor occupancy. Outdoor: must maintain social distancing, not to exceed 150 people. No more than six customers at a table. Workers and customers must follow face covering requirements set forth by DEED. All establishments must close and remain closed each day for on-premises consumption between the hours of 10:00 pm and 4:00 am.  Extended to 20210213 with extension of emergency declaration: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-04%20Final_tcm1055-463085.pdf. Extended to 20210316: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-08%20Final%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-468348.pdf.

Eases gathering restrictions by removing max occupancy for religious services (was 250). (quote) Indoor social gatherings involving not more than two households, up to a maximum of 10 people, are permitted as long as members of different households maintain at least six feet of separation from each other.... Outdoor social gatherings involving not more than three households, up to a maximum of 15 people, are permitted as long as members of different households maintain at least six feet of separation from each other (quote). Places of worship are limited to 50 pct capacity. Extended to 20210213 with extension of emergency declaration: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-04%20Final_tcm1055-463085.pdf. Extended to 20210316: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-08%20Final%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-468348.pdf.

Eases restrictions on outdoor recreational facilities in accordance with the restrictions on other Places of Public Accommodation (indoor allowed, subject to relevant capacity limits and food/beverage curfews). Outdoor gathering groups are limited to 3 households or 15 people. Applicable to the following businesses: all state parks, public and private marinas, public and private golf courses and driving ranges, off-highway vehicle, snowmobiles, and watercraft repair shops, facilities, and showrooms, bait shops, outdoor shooting ranges and game farms, ski areas.  Extended to 20210213 with extension of emergency declaration: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-04%20Final_tcm1055-463085.pdf. Extended to 20210316: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-08%20Final%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-468348.pdf. Eased on 20210315 such that up to 50 individuals may gather outdoors together: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-11%20Final_tcm1055-471550.pdf. Extended to 20210415: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-12_tcm1055-472035.pdf. Extended to 20210515 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-19%20Final%20%28003%29_tcm1055-476482.pdf Further eased on 20210507 to remove capacity and numerical limits outdoors and remove numerical limits indoors https://mn.gov/governor/assets/Signed%20Final%20EO-21-21%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-480440.pdf Extended to 20210613 https://www.lrl.mn.gov/archive/execorders/21-22.pdf Ended on 20210528 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/Signed%20Final%20EO-21-21%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-480440.pdf

PolicyCodingNotes: Eases restaurant restrictions to allow indoor service. Must ensure 6 feet can be maintained between tables, not to exceed 50 pct capacity with a maximum of 150 people in total for indoor occupancy. Outdoor: must maintain social distancing, not to exceed 150 people. No more than six customers at a table. Workers and customers must follow face covering requirements set forth by DEED. All establishments must close and remain closed each day for on-premises consumption between the hours of 10:00 pm and 4:00 am.  Extended to 20210213 with extension of emergency declaration: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-04%20Final_tcm1055-463085.pdf. Extended to 20210316: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-08%20Final%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-468348.pdf.

Eases bar restrictions. Must ensure 6 feet can be maintained between tables, not to exceed 50 pct capacity with a maximum of 250 (from 150) people in total for indoor occupancy. Outdoor: must maintain social distancing, not to exceed 250 (from 150) people. No more than six customers at a table. Workers and customers must follow face covering requirements set forth by DEED. All establishments must close and remain closed each day for on-premises consumption between the hours of 11:00 pm and 4:00 am. Effective 20210315, eased to 75 pct capacity and beginning 20210401, establishments with adequate capacity may exceed the 250-person limit, not to exceed 3,000 indoors or 10,000 outdoors: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-11%20Final_tcm1055-471550.pdf. Extended to 20210415: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-12_tcm1055-472035.pdf. Extended to 20210515 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-19%20Final%20%28003%29_tcm1055-476482.pdf

Eases restaurant restrictions. Must ensure 6 feet can be maintained between tables, not to exceed 50 pct capacity with a maximum of 250 (from 150) people in total for indoor occupancy. Outdoor: must maintain social distancing, not to exceed 250 (from 150) people. No more than six customers at a table. Workers and customers must follow face covering requirements set forth by DEED. All establishments must close and remain closed each day for on-premises consumption between the hours of 11:00 pm and 4:00 am. Effective 20210315, eased to 75 pct capacity and beginning 20210401, establishments with adequate capacity may exceed the 250-person limit, not to exceed 3,000 indoors or 10,000 outdoors: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-11%20Final_tcm1055-471550.pdf. Extended to 20210415: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-12_tcm1055-472035.pdf. Extended to 20210515 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-19%20Final%20%28003%29_tcm1055-476482.pdf

Eases gathering restrictions by permitting up to 15 individuals indoors (from 10) and 50 outdoors (from 15). Places of worship are eased to 100 pct capacity (from 50).  Extended to 20210415: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-12_tcm1055-472035.pdf. Extended to 20210515 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-19%20Final%20%28003%29_tcm1055-476482.pdf

Extends Stay at Home recommendation for vulnerable populations, now exempts vaccinated individuals from recommendation. Persons at risk of severe illness from COVID-19 (quote) and have not yet been vaccinated or cannot be vaccinated (quote) are strongly encouraged to stay home. Extended to 20210415: https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-12_tcm1055-472035.pdf. Extended to 20210515 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-19%20Final%20%28003%29_tcm1055-476482.pdf Extended to 20210613 https://www.lrl.mn.gov/archive/execorders/21-22.pdf Extended to 20210715 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/EO%2021-24%20Final_tcm1055-485447.pdf. Ended with the end of the peacetime emergency declaration 20210701.  https://minnesota.cbslocal.com/2021/06/30/gov-walz-pushes-to-end-covid-emergency-but-keep-certain-powers-1022862/

Eases bar restrictions. Must ensure 6 feet can be maintained between tables, not to exceed 75 pct capacity indoor. Removes capacity limits outdoors. Removes numerical limits of up to 3,000 people indoors and 10,000 people outdoors. No more than ten (from 6) customers at a table. Workers and customers must follow all requirements, including face-covering requirements, as set forth in the Stay Safe Minnesota website: https://staysafe.mn.gov/. Removes curfew. Expiration tied to EmergencyDec. Extended to 20210613 https://www.lrl.mn.gov/archive/execorders/21-22.pdf Ended on 20210528 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/Signed%20Final%20EO-21-21%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-480440.pdf

PolicyCodingNotes: Eases gathering restrictions, permitting up to 50 (from 15) individuals indoors and removing limits outdoors, though in outdoor gatherings (quote) Members of different households are encouraged to maintain six feet of separation from each other (quote). 6 feet of distance between members of different households are required indoors. Places of worship are permitted up to 100 pct capacity.  Extended to 20210613 https://www.lrl.mn.gov/archive/execorders/21-22.pdf Ended on 20210528 https://mn.gov/governor/assets/Signed%20Final%20EO-21-21%20Signed%20and%20Filed_tcm1055-480440.pdf

PolicyCodingNotes: Public school closure. Extended to the end of the school year on 20200414 and re-emphasized with 20200422 issuance https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1476.pdf Began easing of in-person school activities on 20200525 (https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1487.pdf), with in-person instruction to be able to resume on 20200601.

Bars shall suspend dine-in services unless able to reduce capacity to allow no more than 10 people to be gathered in a single place. Drive-thru, carryout, and delivery are allowed and highly encouraged. In effect 20200324 until 20200417.

(quote) residents shall avoid social and non-essential gatherings in groups of more than 10 people (quote). Expressly includes religious entities under essential services exempt from 10 person gathering limit, conditional on CDC and Mississippi Department of Health recommendations. In effect 20200324 until 20200417.
Non-essential businesses can operate conditional on having no more than 10 people in a single space at the same time where individuals are in close proximity to each other.

Restaurants and other dining establishments shall suspend dine-in services unless able to reduce capacity to allow no more than 10 people to be gathered in a single place. Drive-thru, carryout, and delivery are allowed and highly encouraged. In effect 20200324 until 20200417.
Bars and like venues must cease in-person operations, permitting takeaway, drive-thru, etc. for Lauderdale only

All non-essential business operations are to cease within Lauderdale county. Businesses also expressly indicated to close: fitness and exercise gyms, dance studios, clubs, tattoo parlors, spas, salons, barber shops, othe personal care or grooming businesses, amusement parks, museums, playgrounds, movie theaters, bowling alleys, and social clubs. In effect at 10 pm on 20200331 and be in effect until 1159 pm 20200414, so coded to 20200415 expiry.
Restaurants and like venues must cease in-person operations, permitting takeaway, drive-thru, etc. in Lauderdale only
Individuals in Lauderdale County are ordered to stay at home or place of residence. In effect at 10 pm on 20200331 and be in effect until 1159 pm 20200414, so coded to 20200415 expiry.

Statewide, enacts restrictions on bars such that they can only operate for take-away, delivery, curbside etc. No on-premises consumption. Started easing on 20200507: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1478.pdf

State-wide mandate of (quote) all business entities shall cease operation except for Minimum Operations (quote) in Section D. Other businesses expressly indicated to close: fitness and exercise gyms, dance studios, clubs, tattoo parlors, spas, salons, barber shops, other personal care or grooming businesses, all places of amusement and recreation including amusement parks, museums, all parks including beaches, lakes, reservoirs, playgrounds, movie theaters, bowling alleys, and social clubs. In effect at 5 pm on 20200403 at 5 pm until 8 am on 20200420.
Statewide, enacts restrictions on restaurants such that they can only operate for take-away, delivery, curbside etc. No on-premises consumption.

State-wide mandate, (quote) all individuals currently living in the State of Mississippi are ordered to stay at home or in their place of residence (quote) In effect at 5 pm on 20200403 at 5 pm until 8 am on 20200420. Ends on 20200427: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1477.pdf

Eases restrictions on non-essential retail, allowing them to re-open for drive-thru, curbside, or delivery services if business health safety standards are adhered to (i.e., social distancing requirements, no gatherings more than 10 people, regular and proper handwashing, following whatever other guidance MSDH and CDC may have implemented

Eases closures and restrictions on beaches, state park lakes, state lakes and reservoirs, allowing them to re-open conditional maintaining at least 6 ft distancing among groups, no gatherings of more than 10 people, etc.

Further eases retail business restrictions, allowing for in-person services for as long as they limit customers to no more than 50 pct capacity, frequent cleaning of high contact surfaces. Encouraged to have hand sanitizer available upon entry. On 20200914, eases to allow for up to 75 pct capacity: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1522.pdf. Extended to 20210115 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1535.pdf. Extended to 20210203 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1542.pdf. Extended to 20210303: https://mcusercontent.com/08cb3e52aa1308600f84d49ea/files/bf930095-84a3-474b-8507-dcee4b2fbc55/Executive_Order_1543_Extend_Safe_Recovery_and_County_Mask_Order.pdf. Ended on 20210303, with mandated restrictions replaced with recommendations: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1549.pdf

Encourages individuals to stay at home unless engaging in essential activities. Does not renew this portion of the order, ending the statewide recommendation on 20200601: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1492.pdf

All vulnerable individuals (i.e., elderly individuals 65 and older) and individuals with serious underlying health conditions are encouraged to continue sheltering in place. Extended to 20200629 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1496.pdf Extended to 20200720 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1505.pdfhttps://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1505.pdf Extended to 20200930 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1522.pdf Ended on 20200930: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1525.pdf

Allows the reopening of bars provided they undergone thorough cleaning and close by 10 pm and only allow 50 pct capacity, as well as screening of employees and customers. All parties must be seated at least 6 ft from each other, no more than 6 customers at the table, and shared bar areas must remain closed. No live music permitted.

Restaurant and bar employees must wear appropriate PPE, including (quote) every employee who comes into direct contact with customers shall be provided a cloth mask and required to wear that mask while on duty. (quote) Expands sectors where employees must wear a mask over time, particularly for specific counties where mask mandates were imposed until the statewide mask mandate. Eased on 2020930, where while some businesses still required employees to wear masks, more broadly they were encouraged to do so: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1525.pdf. Extended to 20210115 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1535.pdf. Extended to 20210203 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1542.pdf. Extended to 20210303: https://mcusercontent.com/08cb3e52aa1308600f84d49ea/files/bf930095-84a3-474b-8507-dcee4b2fbc55/Executive_Order_1543_Extend_Safe_Recovery_and_County_Mask_Order.pdf. Ended on 20210303, with mandated restrictions replaced with recommendations: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1549.pdf

Further eases restrictions on parks and other outdoor recreational activities, including swimming pools, allowing there to be up to 10 person gatherings indoors and up to 20 person gatherings outdoors conditional adhering to at least 6 ft distancing between each individual. On 20200610, further eases gathering restrictions: 20 for indoor settings and 50 for outdoor settings where social distancing is not possible. Provides higher limits for settings where social distancing is possible, permitting up to 50 people indoors and 100 people outdoors if at least 6 ft distancing can occur. https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1492.pdf. Extended to 20210115 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1535.pdf. Extended to 20210203 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1542.pdf. Extended to 20210303: https://mcusercontent.com/08cb3e52aa1308600f84d49ea/files/bf930095-84a3-474b-8507-dcee4b2fbc55/Executive_Order_1543_Extend_Safe_Recovery_and_County_Mask_Order.pdf. Ended on 20210303, with mandated restrictions replaced with recommendations: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1549.pdf

Allows the reopening of restaurants provided they undergone thorough cleaning and close by 10 pm and only allow 50 pct capacity, as well as screening of employees and customers. All parties must be seated at least 6 ft from each other, no more than 6 customers at the table, and shared bar areas must remain closed. No live music permitted.

Eases restrictions on gyms and fitness centers, allowing for limited in-person services. Gyms may only operate at up to 30 pct maximum capacity, 6 ft distancing among individuals at all times, common areas must be closed. Requires closure to the public by 10 pm. On 20200615, eases restrictions to up to 50 pct capacity but still appearas to need to close by 10 pm: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1496.pdf

Requires individuals to wear face coverings outdoors when attending public events, retail businesses in Attala, Leake, Scott, Jasper, Neshoba, Newton, and Lauderdale Counties only. Coded as a Mandate2 as it is applicable to many indoor settings as well as some outdoor settings. More counties added over time

Extends restaurant restrictions, though allows restaurants that do not serve alcohol have 24-hour per day in-house dining while those that serve alcohol have to close in-house dining to the public no later than 10 pm. Continues prior eased restrictions: maximum of 50 pct capacity, as well as screening of employees and customers. All parties must be seated at least 6 ft from each other, no more than 6 customers at the table, and shared bar areas must remain closed. No live music permitted. Removes 10 pm closing for alcohol-serving locations on 20200615: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1496.pdf Eases on 20200914, allowing up to 75 pct capacity: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1522.pdf. Extended to 20210115 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1535.pdf. Extended to 20210203 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1542.pdf. Extended to 20210303: https://mcusercontent.com/08cb3e52aa1308600f84d49ea/files/bf930095-84a3-474b-8507-dcee4b2fbc55/Executive_Order_1543_Extend_Safe_Recovery_and_County_Mask_Order.pdf. Ended on 20210303, with mandated restrictions replaced with recommendations: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1549.pdf

Eases restrictions on in-person school closures, allowing for weight rooms and training facilities for use by students if they follow the gym safety and health protocols. Outdoor practices also may resume. Allowed in-person instruction to resume on 20200601: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1492.pdf

Gathering restriction to no more than 20 for indoor settings where social distancing is not possible. Extended to 20200629 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1496.pdf Extended to 20200720 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1505.pdfhttps://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1505.pdf

Allows bars to stay open beyond 10 pm. Maintains limit of 50 pct capacity and health safety requirements. Eased on 20200914 to permit 75 pct capacity: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1522.pdf . Extended to 20201211: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1530.pdf. Exteneded to 20210115 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1535.pdf. Extended to 20210203 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1542.pdf. Extended to 20210303: https://mcusercontent.com/08cb3e52aa1308600f84d49ea/files/bf930095-84a3-474b-8507-dcee4b2fbc55/Executive_Order_1543_Extend_Safe_Recovery_and_County_Mask_Order.pdf. Ended on 20210303, with mandated restrictions replaced with recommendations: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1549.pdf

Eases restrictions on outdoor and indoor arenas, permitting them to reopen if they do not operate more than 25 pct capacity, and follow business health and safety protocols. Somewhat expanded on 20201211, reducing capacity limits for indoor arenas to 10 pct, extended to 20210115 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1535.pdf. Extended to 20210203 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1542.pdf. Extended to 20210303: https://mcusercontent.com/08cb3e52aa1308600f84d49ea/files/bf930095-84a3-474b-8507-dcee4b2fbc55/Executive_Order_1543_Extend_Safe_Recovery_and_County_Mask_Order.pdf. Eased on 20210303, now permitting 75 pct capacity and 50 pct capacity in bowl area, and extended to 20210331: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1549.pdf. Further easesd on 20210331 to permit 75 pct capacity in all seating areas: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1550.pdf. Ends restrictions on 20210430  https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1551.pdf

Social gatherings shall be limited to a maximum of 10 participants indoors and 20 participants outdoors (when social distancing not happening) for the following counties: Claiborne, De Soto, Grenada, Harrison, Hinds, Jackson, Jefferson, Madison, Quitman, Rankin, Sunflower, Washington, Wayne. On 20200720, added Bolivar, Covington, Forrest, Humphreys, Panola, Sharkey, Simpson, Tallahatchie, Tate and Walthall to this restriction: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1509.pdf

All indoor gatherings are limited to a maximum of 10 individuals statewide. This limitation does not apply to religious entities, students in classrooms. Counties had been gradually added to a 10 person gathering restriction since 20200710.
All persons residing in Mississippi must immediately home-isolate on first knowledge of infection, and must remain in the home or appropriate residential location for 14 days from onset of illness.

The start of the 2020-21 academic year for public schools in Bolivar, Coahoma, Forrest, George, Hinds, Panola, Sunflower, and Washington Counties for grades 7 thorugh 12 shall be delayed until Monday August 17 2020.

(quote) Every person in Mississippi shall wear a face covering, covering the nose and mouth, while inside a school building or classroom, or when outdoors on a school campus whenever it is not possible to maintain a minimum of six feet of social distancing from another person not in the same household (quote). Exceptions are also noted in the EO. Extended to 20210115 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1535.pdf. Extended to 20210203 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1542.pdf. Extended to 20210303: https://mcusercontent.com/08cb3e52aa1308600f84d49ea/files/bf930095-84a3-474b-8507-dcee4b2fbc55/Executive_Order_1543_Extend_Safe_Recovery_and_County_Mask_Order.pdf. Extended to 20210331: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1549.pdf. Extended to 20210430: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1550.pdf  Extended to 20210531 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1551.pdf Expired and repealed on 20210531 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1551.pdf

Every person in Mississippi shall wear a face covering while inside a business, school, or other building or space open to the public, or when in an outdoor public space whenever it is not possible to maintain a minimum of six feet of social distancing. Exemptions include persons who cannot wear a face covering due to conditions that would cause trouble breathing, while eating and drinking, children under the age of 6. Coded as a Mandate3 under PublicMaskLevel as it broadly applies to indoor and outdoor settings. Extended to 20200930 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1522.pdf Ended on 20200930, replaced with a recommendation: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1525.pdf

When social distancing is not possible, all indoor gatherings are limited to a maximum of 10 individuals statewide, and 50 outside. When social distancing is possible, all indoor gatherings are limited to a maximum of 20 individuals statewide, and 100 outside. This limitation does not apply to religious entities, students in classrooms.

Eases gym and fitness center restrictions, permitting them to be open up to 75 pct capacity. Removes time restrictions, permitting them to be open 24 hours a day. Extended to 20210115 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1535.pdf. Extended to 20210203 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1542.pdf. Extended to 20210303: https://mcusercontent.com/08cb3e52aa1308600f84d49ea/files/bf930095-84a3-474b-8507-dcee4b2fbc55/Executive_Order_1543_Extend_Safe_Recovery_and_County_Mask_Order.pdf.

Eases gathering restrictions. When social distancing is not possible, all indoor gatherings are limited to a maximum of 20 individuals statewide, and 100 outside. This limitation does not apply to religious entities, students in classrooms. Effective 20201111, applies to all counties except Benton, Carroll, Covington, DeSoto, Forrest, Harrison, Humphreys, Jackson, Lamar, Lauderdale, Leflore, Lee, Marshall, Rankin, Yalobusha https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1530.pdf
LastUpdatedNotes: Updated DateExpiry to 20201211 and updated PolicyCodingNotes

PolicyCodingNotes: (quote) all persons in Mississippi are strongly encouraged to follow the CDC and Mississippi DoH guidelines...wearing a face covering, covering the nose and mouth, while in public spaces wheenver it is not possible to maintain a minimum of 6 ft of social distancing from persons not in the same household (quote). Effective 20201111, applies to all counties except Benton, Carroll, Covington, DeSoto, Forrest, Harrison, Humphreys, Jackson, Lamar, Lauderdale, Leflore, Lee, Marshall, Rankin, Yalobusha https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1530.pdf. Extended to 20210115 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1535.pdf. Effective 20201223, applies to Claiborne, Issaquena, Sharkey, Tunica https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1539.pdf. Effective 20210115, applies to Adams, Issaquena, Jefferson, Lawrence, Quitman, Sharkey, Wilkinson https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1542.pdf. Extended to 20210303: https://mcusercontent.com/08cb3e52aa1308600f84d49ea/files/bf930095-84a3-474b-8507-dcee4b2fbc55/Executive_Order_1543_Extend_Safe_Recovery_and_County_Mask_Order.pdf. Made statewide again on 20210303, extended to 20210331: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1549.pdf. Extended to 20210430: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1550.pdf  Extended without expiry on 20210430 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1551.pdf

Social gatherings shall be limited to a maximum of 10 individuals indoors and 50 individuals outdoors when social distancing is not possible for the following counties: Chickasaw, Claiborne, DeSoto, Forrest, Itawamba, Jackson, Lamar, Lee, and Neshoba. This limitation does not apply to religious entities, students in classrooms. Expanded on 20201028 to include Benton, Carroll, Harrison, Jones, Leake, Madison, and Marshall conuties: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1528.pdf. Effective 20201111, Benton, Carroll, Covington, DeSoto, Forrest, Harrison, Humphreys, Jackson, Lamar, Lauderdale, Leflore, Lee, Marshall, Rankin, Yalobusha counties are under this gathering restriction https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1530.pdf. Effective 20201118, adds Hinds, Itawamba, Madison, Montegomery, Pontotoc, Tate and Winston counties to this restriction https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1531.pdf. Effective 20201125, adds Alcorn, Attala, Bolivar, Chickasaw, Choctaw, Jefferson Davis, Jones, Lafayette, Lawrence, Lincoln, Lowndes, Neshoba, Panola, Perry, Prentiss, Stone, Tippah, Tishomingo, Union counties to this restriction https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1532.pdf

Requires individuals in Chickasaw, Claiborne, DeSoto, Forrest, Itawamba, Jackson, Lamar, Lee, and Neshoba counties to wear a face covering. Coded as Mandate2 because requires individuals to wear a mask (quote) when inside a business, school, building or other indoor space (quote) when social distancing is not possible. Expanded on 20201028 to include Benton, Carroll, Harrison, Jones, Leake, Madison, and Marshall conuties: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1528.pdf. Effective 20201111, Benton, Carroll, Covington, DeSoto, Forrest, Harrison, Humphreys, Jackson, Lamar, Lauderdale, Leflore, Lee, Marshall, Rankin, Yalobusha counties are under this mask mandate https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1530.pdf. Effective 20201118, adds Hinds, Itawamba, Madison, Montegomery, Pontotoc, Tate and Winston counties to this restriction https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1531.pdf. Effective 20201125, adds Alcorn, Attala, Bolivar, Chickasaw, Choctaw, Jefferson Davis, Jones, Lafayette, Lawrence, Lincoln, Lowndes, Neshoba, Panola, Perry, Prentiss, Stone, Tippah, Tishomingo, Union counties to this restriction https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1532.pdf. Extended to 20210115 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1535.pdf. Effective 20201223, applies to all counties except Claiborne, Issaquena, Sharkey, Tunica https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1539.pdf. Effective 20210115, applies to Alcorn, Amite, Attala, Benton, Bolivar, Calhoun, Carroll, Chickasaw, Choctaw, Claiborne, Clarke, Clay, Coahoma, Copiah, Covington, Desoto, Forrest, Franklin, George, Greene, Grenada, Hancock, Harrison, Hinds, Holmes, Humphreys, Itawamba, Jackson, Jasper, Davis, Jones, Kemper, Lafayette, Lamar, Lauderdale, Leake, Lee, Leflore, Lincoln, Lowndes, Madison, Marion, Marshall, Monroe, Montgomery, Neshoba, Newton, Noxubee, Oktibbeha, Panola, Pearl River, Perry, Pike, Pontotoc, Prentiss, Rankin, Scott, Simpson, Smith, Stone, Sunflower, Tallahatchie, Tate, Tippah, Tishomingo, Tunica, Union, Walthall, Washington, Warren, Wayne, Webster, Winston, Yalobusha, Yazoo https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1542.pdf. Extended to 20210303: https://mcusercontent.com/08cb3e52aa1308600f84d49ea/files/bf930095-84a3-474b-8507-dcee4b2fbc55/Executive_Order_1543_Extend_Safe_Recovery_and_County_Mask_Order.pdf.

Gathering restriction is now statewide. When social distancing is not possible, all gatherings are limited to a maximum of 10 individuals indoors and 50 outdoors. This limitation does not apply to religious entities, students in classrooms. Extended to 20210203 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1542.pdf. Extended to 20210303: https://mcusercontent.com/08cb3e52aa1308600f84d49ea/files/bf930095-84a3-474b-8507-dcee4b2fbc55/Executive_Order_1543_Extend_Safe_Recovery_and_County_Mask_Order.pdf.

Recommends that all businesses adopt (quote) measures to encourage appropriate PPE to be worn by all employees while at work or on duty based on their duties and responsibilities and in adherence to federal, state and local regulations and guidelines (quote). For close contact and personal care services, (quote) Every employee should be encouraged to wear a face covering, covering the nose and mouth, while on duty...Customers should be encouraged to wear a face covering, covering the nose and mouth, while inside the facility except when receiving a service that otherwise could not be provided while wearing a face covering (quote). Extended to 20210430: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1550.pdf  Extended without expiry on 20210430 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1551.pdf

(quote) Avoid large gatherings, particularly indoor gatherings...Maintain social distancing between persons not in your household (quote). Extended to 20210430: https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1550.pdf  Extended without expiry on 20210430 https://www.sos.ms.gov/content/executiveorders/ExecutiveOrders/1551.pdf

Recommends that (quote) all Mississippi residents 65 years of age and older should avoid all indoor mass gatherings (regardless of vaccination status)...All Mississippi residents with chronic underlying medical conditions should avoid all indoor mass gatherings (regardless of vaccination status). (quote)  Extended on 20210729: https://msdh.ms.gov/msdhsite/_static/14,21866,420.html
Recommends that all unvaccinated individuals wear a mask when indoors in public settings. Extended on 20210728 and expanded to include all people regardless of vaccination status.

State of Emergency declaration on 20200313. Original expiry was 20200515. On 20200424, expiry extended to 20200615, expiry extended to 20201230, expiry extended to 20210331. Extended to 20210831 https://www.sos.mo.gov/library/reference/orders/2021/eo7.
Strongly urges the cancellation or suspension of public gatherings of 50 people or more
LastUpdatedNotes: Updated StatePolicy to GathRestrict with a Mandate of 0

PolicyCodingNotes: Limited operations required (can have drive-thru, pick-up, delivery options): bars. The 20200427 order eases restrictions for in-person services effective 20200504: https://governor.mo.gov/press-releases/archive/governor-parson-announces-first-phase-show-me-strong-recovery-plan-begin-may.
LastUpdatedNotes: Added TakeawayOnly to BusinessRestrictLevel, and updated PolicyCodingNotes

PolicyCodingNotes: Orders the following (quote) every person in the State of Missouri shall avoid social gatherings of more than 10 people (quote). Extended through 20200504 via stay-at-home order extension. Eased 20200504 https://health.mo.gov/living/healthcondiseases/communicable/novel-coronavirus/pdf/economic-reopening.pdf
LastUpdatedNotes: Removed DateEnded and added to DateEased

PolicyCodingNotes: Limited operations required (can have drive-thru, pick-up, delivery options: restaurants The 20200427 order eases restrictions for dining in effective 20200504: https://governor.mo.gov/press-releases/archive/governor-parson-announces-first-phase-show-me-strong-recovery-plan-begin-may.
LastUpdatedNotes: Added TakeawayOnly to BusinessRestrictLevel and removed DateEnded

PolicyCodingNotes: All schools to close on 20200324, closure is supposed to be through end of the academic year (order regarding this goes through 202000601). Order on 20200528 indicates summer school and other on-campus activities may proceed under guidelines set forth by the Department of Elementary and Secondary education, so coded as easing https://health.mo.gov/living/healthcondiseases/communicable/novel-coronavirus/pdf/economic-reopening61-15.pdf Ended at the state-level on 20200714: https://bloximages.newyork1.vip.townnews.com/kctv5.com/content/tncms/assets/v3/editorial/9/83/983c5b34-94a7-11ea-8c80-c7d0392bf8a2/5ebb2ff4452e0.pdf.pdf

Requires the closure of coin-operated amusement device and slot machines for public use (essentially casinos). Expires with Executive Order 20-02, the State of Emergency declaration. Closure is extended with emergency declaration declaration to 20200615 https://www.sos.mo.gov/CMSImages/Library/Reference/Orders/2020/20-09.pdf Ended on 20200616 https://governor.mo.gov/show-me-strong-recovery-plan-guidance-and-frequently-asked-questions

(quote) Any entity that does not employ individuals to perform essential worker functions....shall adhere to the limitations on social gatherings and social distancing set forth in sections 4 and 5 of this Order. Entities that do not employ individuals to perform essential worker functions may request a waiver from the limitation on social gatherings, as set forth in section 4 of this Order, from the Director of the Department of Economic Development, on a form prescribed by the Director. For offices and workplaces that remain open, individuals shall practice good hygiene and, where feasible, work from home in order to achieve optimum isolation from COVID-19. (quote) Coding as NEBusinessClose of with a BusinessRestrictLevel of IndoorAllowed and InGathLim of 10 and OutGathLim of 10. Essential retail have capacity limits of either 25 pct or 10 pct capacity per their building codes. However, since this limits are expressly applied to essential businesses, these capacity limits are not applied to this entry. Eased on 20200504: https://health.mo.gov/living/healthcondiseases/communicable/novel-coronavirus/pdf/economic-reopening.pdf Ended on 20200616: https://governor.mo.gov/show-me-strong-recovery-plan-guidance-and-frequently-asked-questions

In effect at 1201 AM on 20200406, expires 1159 PM on 20200424. (quote) Individuals currently residing within the State of Missouri shall avoid leaving their homes or place of residence (quote). Extension through 20200504 https://health.mo.gov/living/healthcondiseases/communicable/novel-coronavirus/pdf/stay-at-home-order-extended.pdf Ended stay at home order as of 20200504 https://health.mo.gov/living/healthcondiseases/communicable/novel-coronavirus/pdf/economic-reopening.pdf
LastUpdatedNotes: Added DateEnded of 20200504. On 20200429, updated DateExpiry to 20200504

PolicyCodingNotes: Recommends that individuals in the State of Missouri to wear a cloth facing covering in public settings

Eases restrictions on bars, allowing them to provide in-person services as long as social distancing meaures and precautionary public health measures are adhered to (eg, at least 6 ft between tables, lack of communical seating, having no more than 10 people at a single table). Ends on 20200616: https://governor.mo.gov/show-me-strong-recovery-plan-guidance-and-frequently-asked-questions

(quote) In accordance with the guidelines from the President and the Centers for Disease Control andPrevention (CDC), every person and business in the State of Missouri shall abide by social distancing requirements, including maintaining six feet of space between individuals....This provision shall apply in all situations, including, but not limited to, when customers are standing in line or individuals are using shared indoor or outdoor spaces (quote). Coded as a gathering restriction without numeric limits. On 20200616, ends all restrictions: https://governor.mo.gov/show-me-strong-recovery-plan-guidance-and-frequently-asked-questions

Eases restrictions specifically for businesses engaged in retail sales to the public (no longer distinguishing between essential v. non-essential retail), now permitting up to 25 pct capacity if the building has a sq footage less than 10,000 sq ft or up to 10 pct capacity if a buliding is 10,000 sq ft or more. Also requires social distancing, etc. (quote) This provision shall apply in all situations, including, but not limited to, when customers are standing in line or individuals are using shared indoor or outdoor spaces. (quote) Ended on 20200616: https://governor.mo.gov/show-me-strong-recovery-plan-guidance-and-frequently-asked-questions

Eases restrictions on restaurants, allowing them to provide dining-in services as long as social distancing meaures and precautionary public health measures are adhered to (eg, at least 6 ft between tables, lack of communical seating, having no more than 10 people at a single table). Ended on 20200616 https://governor.mo.gov/show-me-strong-recovery-plan-guidance-and-frequently-asked-questions

Extends school closure through the end of the 2019-2020 academic year, but indicates that summer school and other on-campus activities may proceed under guidelines set forth by the Department of Elementary and Secondary education. Ended on 20200714 with devolution to local authorities: https://bloximages.newyork1.vip.townnews.com/kctv5.com/content/tncms/assets/v3/editorial/9/83/983c5b34-94a7-11ea-8c80-c7d0392bf8a2/5ebb2ff4452e0.pdf.pdf

State of Emergency declaration. Does not appear to include formal expiry. On 20210113, the original declaration issued by Governor Bullock is rescinded and replaced with a new and identical state of emergency declaration under new Governor Gianforte who took office 20210104. No expiration date included.  Ended on 20210630 https://governor.mt.gov/EO-10-2021-Rescinding-Emergency-Order.pdf
Strongly recommends public limits gatherings to 50 or less. Does not formally restrict gatherings.
LastUpdatedNotes: Updated StatePolicy to GathRestrict with a Mandate of 0

PolicyCodingNotes: All non-residential public schools to close effective immediately, through 20200327, hence SchoolRestrictLevel is NoInPerson. On 20200324, closure extended to 20200410 http://governor.mt.gov/Portals/16/Closure%20Extensions%20and%20Social%20Distancing.pdf?ver=2020-03-24-164313-497 Devovles control to local school districts as of 20200507, allowing schools to make their own reopening decisions. https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/04-22-20%20Directive%20and%20Appx%20-%20Reopening%20Phase%20One.pdf?ver=2020-04-22-124954-977

Limited operations required (delivery, window service, drive through): bars, taverns, breweries, distilleries, wineries, and alcoholic beverage service businesses. In effect at 8 pm on 20200320, Initial expiry is 20200327 at 1159 pm, so 20200328. On 20200324, order extended this through 20200410 http://governor.mt.gov/Portals/16/Closure%20Extensions%20and%20Social%20Distancing.pdf?ver=2020-03-24-164313-497. Easing begins on 20200504 https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/04-22-20%20Directive%20and%20Appx%20-%20Reopening%20Phase%20One.pdf?ver=2020-04-22-124954-977

Closure required: casinos, fitness centers, entertainment venues, indoor facilities in ski areas, bowling alleys, music halls. In effect at 8 pm on 20200320. Initial expiry is 20200327 at 1159 pm, so 20200328. At least some easing of these businesses (eg, casinos) can start 20200504 https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/04-22-20%20Directive%20and%20Appx%20-%20Reopening%20Phase%20One.pdf?ver=2020-04-22-124954-977 More easing on 20200508 Effective May 15, 2020, the following businesses can become operational during Phase I under strict physical distancing and reduced capacity protocols in accordance with the Phase One Directive and the Guidance attached to this Directive: Gyms and fitness studios, Pools at gyms, Theaters, including movie theaters, Museums https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/Phase%20One%20Expansion%20Plus%20Guidance.pdf?ver=2020-05-08-150423-113 Further easing moving into Phase 2 on 20200601 allowing most places to open at 75 pct capacity https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/Phase%20Two%20Directive%20with%20Appendices.pdf?ver=2020-05-19-145442-350. Restrictions ended on 20210115 https://covid19.mt.gov/_docs/Directive_on_2-2021.pdf

Limited operations required (delivery, window service, drive through): restaurants, food establishments. In effect at 8 pm on 20200320, Initial expiry is 20200327 at 1159 pm, so 20200328. On 20200324, order extended this through 20200410 http://governor.mt.gov/Portals/16/Closure%20Extensions%20and%20Social%20Distancing.pdf?ver=2020-03-24-164313-497. Easing begins on 20200504 https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/04-22-20%20Directive%20and%20Appx%20-%20Reopening%20Phase%20One.pdf?ver=2020-04-22-124954-977

Non-essential social and recreational gatherings greater than 10 are prohibited immediately. As of 20200328 expands the gathering restriction https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/Stay%20at%20Home%20Directive.pdf?ver=2020-03-26-173332-177

Non-essential social and recreational gatherings of any number of people are prohibited immediately. As of 20200426, ends gathering restrictions https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/04-22-20%20Directive%20and%20Appx%20-%20Reopening%20Phase%20One.pdf?ver=2020-04-22-124954-977

(quote) All businesses and operations in the State, except Esssential Businesses and Operations as defined below, are required to cease all activities (quote). In effect at 1201 am 20200328, initial expiry is through 20200410. Started easing NEBusinessClose on 20200427 https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/04-22-20%20Directive%20and%20Appx%20-%20Reopening%20Phase%20One.pdf?ver=2020-04-22-124954-977 Further easing moving into Phase 2 on 20200601 https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/Phase%20Two%20Directive%20with%20Appendices.pdf?ver=2020-05-19-145442-350

In effect at 1201 am 20200328, initial expiry is through 20200410. Policy ended on 20200426 https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/04-22-20%20Directive%20and%20Appx%20-%20Reopening%20Phase%20One.pdf?ver=2020-04-22-124954-977

Any person coming to Montana must self-quarantine for 14 days, anyone who has already arrived must self-quarantine for the remainder of the 14 day period. As of 20200601, quarantine mandate ends https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/Phase%20Two%20Directive%20with%20Appendices.pdf?ver=2020-05-19-145442-350

Eases the previous gathering restriction to a recommendation. (quote) All individuals should avoid gathering in groups of more than 10 people in circumsntances that do not readily allow for appropriate physical distancing (quote). Eased on 20200601 http://governor.mt.gov/Portals/16/Directive%20on%20Bars%20and%20Restaurants.pdf?ver=2020-03-20-101314-940

Recommends that all vulnerable individuals should continue to follow stay-at-home guidance, with vulnerable individuals being those over 65, with serious underlying health conditions (e.g., high blood pressure, chronic lung disease, obesity, asthma) or individuals whose immune systems are compromised. Extended on 20200601 https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/Phase%20Two%20Directive%20with%20Appendices.pdf?ver=2020-05-19-145442-350. Under new Governor order, extended on 20210114 https://covid19.mt.gov/_docs/Directive-on-2-2021-State-Law.pdf. Ended with repeal of all prior directives on 20210212: https://covid19.mt.gov/_docs/2-12-2021-Directive.pdf.

Eases previous business closures, with businesses eligible for re-opening are main street and retail businesses if they adhere to re-opening guidelines. Physical distancing of 6 ft must be maintained between customers and this may require a reduction in capacity, a reduction of seating in service or waiting areas, management of waiting areas and lines or systems that reduce amount of contact time. Health assessments of employees must be conducted at beginning of each shift. Outdoor recreation (such as public lands, fishing sites, parks) can also become operational if sites adhere to strict physical distancing between groups and exercise frequent sanitation. Personal care services may also reopen under the re-opening guidelines. Ended on 20210115 https://covid19.mt.gov/_docs/Directive_on_2-2021.pdf

Eases restrictions on bars, taverns, breweries, distilleries, wineries, and alcoholic beverage service businesses, allowing them to be operational for in-person services if they follow strict physical distancing and reduced capacity protocols (50 pct), as well as closing operations strictly by 1130 pm and expansions for delivery as possible. Tables must be limited to 6 people. Sitting or standing at bars not allowed. Self-service buffets and drink refills not allowed. Further easing on 20200601 as Phase Two allows them to operate at 75 pct capacity: https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/Phase%20Two%20Directive%20with%20Appendices.pdf?ver=2020-05-19-145442-350.

Easing restrictions for casinos to open, conditional on following Phase One general and specific guidelines under the EO, including a 50 pct limit on normal operating capacity. On 20200601 further eases to 75 pct capacity as part of Phase Two: https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/Phase%20Two%20Directive%20with%20Appendices.pdf?ver=2020-05-19-145442-350

Eases restraurant restrictions, allowing them to re-open if they follow strict physical distancing and reduced capacity protocols (50 pct of normal operating capacity), as well as closing operations strictly by 1130 pm and expansions for delivery as possible. Tables must be limited to 6 people. Sitting or standing at bars not allowed. Self-service buffets and drink refills not allowed. Eased on 20200601, permitting up to 75 pct: https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/Phase%20Two%20Directive%20with%20Appendices.pdf?ver=2020-05-19-145442-350 On 20201120, re-expands restrictions, requiring no more than 50 pct capacity and closure by 10 pm: https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/2020-11-17_Directive%20on%20Group%20Size%20and%20Capacity%20-%20FINAL.pdf?ver=2020-11-17-150044-130

Recommends that individuals wear masks while in public. (quote) Strongly consider using non-medical face coverings while in public, especially in circumstances that do not readily allow for appropriate physical distancing (e.g., grocery/retail stores, pharmacies, public transportation). (quote)
(quote) Effective June 1, avoid gathering in groups of more than 50 people in circumstances that do not readily allow for appropriate physical distancing (quote). Coded as a gathering recommendation

Requires that all public-facing employees, contractors, and volunteers to wear a face covering at all businesses, government offices, or other persons responsible for indoor spaces open to the public. Exemptions are for those seeking to communicate with someone who is hearing impaired, persons giving speeches or performances. On 20201120, extends statewide public mask requirement. https://covid19.mt.gov/Portals/223/Documents/2020-11-17_Directive%20on%20Group%20Size%20and%20Capacity%20-%20FINAL.pdf?ver=2020-11-17-150044-130. On 20210115, Extends statewide public mask requirement. https://covid19.mt.gov/_docs/Directive_on_2-2021.pdf. Ended on 20210212: https://covid19.mt.gov/_docs/2-12-2021-Directive.pdf.

(quote) all businesses, government offices, or other persons responsible for indoor spaces open to the public shall require and take reasonable measures to ensure that all employees, contractors, volunteers, customers, or other members of the public wear a face covering that covers their mouth and nose at all times while entering or remaining in any indoor spaces open to the public (quote). For all outdoor gatherings of 50 or more people, individuals are required to wear face coverings when it is not possible to maintain at least 6 ft of physical distance. Exemptions for children under 5, for individuals for whom wearing a mask is not medically possible, during exercise, etc. Technically only applies to counties with 4 or more confirmed active cases of COVID-19 (stongly encourages counties with 3 or fewer confirmed active cases to wear masks), but these locations are not clearly listed - subsequently, treating this as a statewide mandate. Coding as a Mandate2 for PublicMaskLevel as its requirements for outdoor settings are very limited. Expanded on 20201120 to require face coverings in all counties, regardless of case count: https://covid19.mt.gov/_docs/2020-11-17_Directive-on-Group-Size-and-Capacity-FINAL.pdf. Expanded on 20210115. https://covid19.mt.gov/_docs/Directive_on_2-2021.pdf

Mandates the use of face coverings at all public and private K-12 schools per the July 15 mask mandate such that indoor school spaces are considered indoor spaces open to the public and school-related outdoor activities are considered organied outdoor activities. From the July 15 order: (quote) all businesses, government offices, or other persons responsible for indoor spaces open to the public shall require and take reasonable measures to ensure that all employees, contractors, volunteers, customers, or other members of the public wear a face covering that covers their mouth and nose at all times while entering or remaining in any indoor spaces open to the public (quote). For all outdoor gatherings of 50 or more people, individuals are required to wear face coverings when it is not possible to maintain at least 6 ft of physical distance. Exemptions for children under 5, for individuals for whom wearing a mask is not medically possible, during exercise, etc. Technically only applies to counties with 4 or more confirmed active cases of COVID-19 (strongly encourages counties with 3 or fewer confirmed active cases to wear masks), but these locations are not clearly listed - subsequently, treating this as a statewide mandate. Expanded on 20201120 to require face coverings in all counties, regardless of case count: https://covid19.mt.gov/_docs/2020-11-17_Directive-on-Group-Size-and-Capacity-FINAL.pdf. On 20210115, extends statewide public mask requirement in indoor spaces. https://covid19.mt.gov/_docs/Directive_on_2-2021.pdf. Ended on 20210212: https://covid19.mt.gov/_docs/2-12-2021-Directive.pdf.

Reduces capacity for bars, requiring them to be limited to 50 pct of normal capacity. Requires tables to be limited to no more than 6 people, must establish at least 6 ft distancing between groups and tables. Requires closures from 10 pm to 4 am. Ended on 20210115 https://covid19.mt.gov/_docs/Directive_on_2-2021.pdf

Expands gathering restrictions, (quote) Any public gatherings or events where it is not possible to practice social distancing or where social distancing is not being practiced must be strictly limited to 25 people or fewer (quote). Exempts houses of worship, wherein social distancing should occur for all in-person services. 20210115, ends specific gathering restrictions and instead provides the following recommendation that (quote) Any public gatherings or events should be managed in a way that accommodates CDC social distancing guidelines (quote). https://covid19.mt.gov/_docs/Directive_on_2-2021.pdf

Reduces capacity for casinos, requiring them to operate at no more than 50 pct capacity of normal operating occupancy. Requires no more than 6 people at a table at a time, requires 6 ft distancing among parties, and businesses must close 10 pm to 4 am. Ended on 20210115 https://covid19.mt.gov/_docs/Directive_on_2-2021.pdf

Reduces capacity for restaurants, requiring them to be limited to 50 pct of normal capacity. Requires tables to be limited to no more than 6 people, must establish at least 6 ft distancing between groups and tables. Requires closures from 10 pm to 4 am. Ended on 20210115 https://covid19.mt.gov/_docs/Directive_on_2-2021.pdf

Ends specific gathering restrictions and instead provides the following recommendation that (quote) Any public gatherings or events should be managed in a way that accommodates CDC social distancing guidelines (quote). https://covid19.mt.gov/_docs/Directive_on_2-2021.pdf. Extended on 20210212 and tied to Emergency Declaration: https://covid19.mt.gov/_docs/2-12-2021-Directive.pdf.  Recommendation ended with the state of emergency on 20210630 https://governor.mt.gov/EO-10-2021-Rescinding-Emergency-Order.pdf

Expands public mask mandate. Face coverings are now required in all counties regardless of case count. (quote) A face covering that covers the mouth and nose shall be worn at all times in indoor spaces open to the public...For any organized outdoor activity where social distancing is not possible or is not observed, a face covering that covers the mouth and nose shall be worn at all times. (quote) Coding as a Mandate3 for PublicMaskLevel as its requirements for indoor and outdoor settings is broad. Ended on 20210212: https://covid19.mt.gov/_docs/2-12-2021-Directive.pdf.

(quote) Montanans are encouraged to wear masks (quote). Businesses should make (quote) reasonable efforts (quote) to develop policies around masking.  Ended with the state of emergency on 20210630 https://governor.mt.gov/EO-10-2021-Rescinding-Emergency-Order.pdf
(quote) Montanans are encouraged to wear masks (quote) Ended with the state of emergency on 20210630 https://governor.mt.gov/EO-10-2021-Rescinding-Emergency-Order.pdf

(quote) Montanans are encouraged to wear masks (quote) and (quote) Schools should make reasonable efforts to follow school guidelines and best practices recommended by the CDC (quote). Ended with the state of emergency on 20210630 https://governor.mt.gov/EO-10-2021-Rescinding-Emergency-Order.pdf

State of Emergency declaration. Does not appear to include formal expiry.  Ends state of emergency at 1159pm 20210630, so coding as 20210701. https://www.dropbox.com/s/6fqhkgg95rtq532/EO%20No.%2021-09%20-%20Rescission%20of%20Pandemic%20Emergency%20Executive%20Orders.pdf?dl=0

(quote) Restaurants and bars must limit to 10 people. And are strongly encouraged to move to drive-thru/takeout only through the end of March (quote) Coded to a requirement of limiting on-premises services to no more than 10 people in a single room.
Recommends to limit the size of events and public gatherings to no more than 50 people for the next 8 weeks
Guidance is that social gatherings should be limited to no more than 10 people, and expressly applies to church services per press release from the governor.

(quote) Restaurants and bars must limit to 10 people. And are strongly encouraged to move to drive-thru/takeout only through the end of March (quote) Coded to a requirement of limiting on-premises services to no more than 10 people in a single room.

Limited operations required (carry-out, delivery, drive-thru only): bars and taverns. No onsite consumption permitted. In effect for Cass, Douglas, Sarpy and Washington counties. Expiry is 20200430. More counties are added through the 20200403

All gatherings that bring together more than 10 people in a single space or single room at a time are prohibited in Cass, Douglas, Sarpy, and Washington. In the press release, it clearly indicates these requirements apply to houses of worship.

Limits the following businesses to operating with no more than 10 people in a single space or room at a time: gymnasium, salon, fitness center, auditorium, stadium, arena, large event conference room, meeting hall, theater, library, or any other confined indoor or outdoor space, as well as parades, fairs, festivals, concerts, etc. in the following locations: Cass, Douglas, Sarpy, Washington
Limited operations required (carry-out, delivery, drive-thru only): restaurants. In effect for Cass, Douglas, Sarpy and Washington counties. Continues to add more counties through 20200403.
Per governor, schools in Cass, Douglas, Sarpy, Washington are required to operate without students in their buildings to 20200430

Individuals who test positive for COVID-19 or have symptoms of COVID-19 (presumptive case) and individuals who reside with individudals who have tested positive for COVID-19 or are presumptive cases shall home-quarantine for a period of no less than 14 days. Applicable to Cass, Douglas, Sarpy counties until April 30, and applicable to Lancaster, Dodge, Saunders, and Washington counties until May 6, hence coding with the soonest expiry. More counties are added through 20200403

Recommends that international travelers and returning travelers from locations in the US with widespread community spread should self-quarantine for 14 days following return. Because the recommendation does not provide specific locations in the US beyond cities and counties (i.e., New York City, Santa Clara County, Seattle, WA), we are not including specific locations under AppliesTo

Schools statewide are directed to operate without students in their buildings to May 31, 2020. Eased on 20200601, permitting school-based sports teams to resume practices: http://dhhs.ne.gov/Documents/COVID-19-Outline-of-Changes-to-Upcoming-DHMs-Phase-II.pdf

Remaining counties are put under the directed health measures, and are thus required to close bars for on premises consumption (takeaway, curbside, delivery only). Different expiry dates are currently applied by county group so we are using the earliest: 20200430 for Cass, Douglas, Sarpy, 20200506 for Burt, Butler, Cuming, Dodge, Hall, Hamilton, Lancaster, Madison, Merrick, Polk, Saunders, Seward, Stanton, Washington, York and 20200511 Adams, Antelope, Arthur, Blaine, Boone, Banner, Box Butte, Boyd, Brown, Buffalo, Cedar, Chase, Cherry, Cheyenne, Clay, Colfax, Custer, Dakota, Dawes, Dawson, Deuel, Dixon, Dundy, Fillmore, Franklin, Frontier, Furnas, Gage, Garden, Garfield, Gosper, Grant, Greeley, Harlan, Hayes, Hitchcock, Holt, Hooker, Howard, Jefferson, Johnson, Kearney, Keith, Keya Paha, Kimball, Knox, Lincoln, Logan, Loup, McPherson, Morrill, Nance, Nemaha, Nuckolls, Otoe, Pawnee, Perkins, Phelps, Pierce, Platte, Red Willow, Richardson, Rock, Saline, Scotts Bluff, Sheridan, Sherman, Sioux, Thayer, Thomas, Thurston, Valley, Wayne, Webster, Wheeler. Easing began for a subset of counties on 20200601: http://dhhs.ne.gov/Documents/COVID-19-Outline-of-Changes-to-Upcoming-DHMs-Phase-II.pdf

Individuals who test positive for COVID-19 or have symptoms of COVID-19 (presumptive case) and individuals who reside with indiviudals who have tested positive for COVID-19 or are presumptive cases shall home-quarantine for a period of no less than 14 days. Eased on 20200601, allowing for the self-quarantine period to be 10 days. Extended to 20200914: http://dhhs.ne.gov/Pages/Phase-3-and-Phase-4-Directed-Health-Measures-Extended-Until-Sept.-13.aspx Extended to 20201101 with latest set of directed health measures: http://dhhs.ne.gov/Pages/DHHS-Friday-COVID-19-Update-09112020.aspx Extends to 20201201: http://dhhs.ne.gov/Documents/SHHD-DHM-October.pdf Eased to allow for reduced isolation time if they are fever free and based on testing, but also extended to 20210101: http://dhhs.ne.gov/Documents/SHHD-DHM-December.pdf. On 20201224 extended to 20210201: https://www.swhealth.ne.gov/pdfs/featuredtopics/COVID-19/State%20Guidelines/SWHD-18-DHM-December12.24.2020.pdf. Eases case-based isolation requirements on 20210130: http://dhhs.ne.gov/Documents/SHHD-DHM-January.pdf.

Remaining counties are put under the directed health measures, and thus the following applies statewide: all gatherings that bring together more than 10 people in a single space or single room at a time are prohibited. Different expiry dates are currently applied by county group so we are using the earliest: 20200430 for Cass, Douglas, Sarpy, 20200506 for Burt, Butler, Cuming, Dodge, Hall, Hamilton, Lancaster, Madison, Merrick, Polk, Saunders, Seward, Stanton, Washington, York and 20200511 Adams, Antelope, Arthur, Blaine, Boone, Banner, Box Butte, Boyd, Brown, Buffalo, Cedar, Chase, Cherry, Cheyenne, Clay, Colfax, Custer, Dakota, Dawes, Dawson, Deuel, Dixon, Dundy, Fillmore, Franklin, Frontier, Furnas, Gage, Garden, Garfield, Gosper, Grant, Greeley, Harlan, Hayes, Hitchcock, Holt, Hooker, Howard, Jefferson, Johnson, Kearney, Keith, Keya Paha, Kimball, Knox, Lincoln, Logan, Loup, McPherson, Morrill, Nance, Nemaha, Nuckolls, Otoe, Pawnee, Perkins, Phelps, Pierce, Platte, Red Willow, Richardson, Rock, Saline, Scotts Bluff, Sheridan, Sherman, Sioux, Thayer, Thomas, Thurston, Valley, Wayne, Webster, Wheeler. Extended to 20200504. Easing began on 20200504: http://dhhs.ne.gov/Pages/COVID-19-Directed-Health-Measures.aspx

Remaining counties are put under the directed health measures, and thus the following applies statewide: limits the following businesses to operating with no more than 10 people in a single space or room at a time at a gymnasium, salon, fitness center, auditorium, stadium, arena, large event conference room, meeting hall, theater, library, or any other confined indoor or outdoor space, as well as parades, fairs, festivals, concerts, etc. Eased on 20200601,  permitting them to operate up to the greater of 25 patrons or up to 25 pct (no more than 3,000 individuals) in a single space or room at a time at an auditorium, stadium, arena, large event conference room, meeting hall, library, or any other confined indoor or outdoor space. Gyms may operate at the greater of 25 patrons or up to 50 pct capacity, at least 6 ft distancing required, etc. http://dhhs.ne.gov/Documents/COVID-19-Outline-of-Changes-to-Upcoming-DHMs-Phase-II.pdf Further eases for Phase II and Phase III counties on 20200622: https://governor.nebraska.gov/press/gov-ricketts-announces-new-directed-health-measures-effective-june-22nd-proclaims-%E2%80%9Cdairy-month Gyms are allowed to fully reopen with recommendations starting on 20200724 for Phase IV counties: http://dhhs.ne.gov/Documents/LBHD-DHM-July24.pdf On 20201021, expands gathering restriction in all regional health departments, a maximum of 50 pct occupancy (not to exceed 10,000) for indoor facilities and maximum 10,000 for outdoor facilities at the following businesses: auditoriums, stadiums, arenas, large event conferences: http://dhhs.ne.gov/Documents/SHHD-DHM-October.pdf Then further expands to 25 pct capacity on 20201111: http://dhhs.ne.gov/Documents/Outline-of-Changes-to-Upcoming-DHMs-November9.pdf Began easing on 20201212, increasing capacity 50 pct: https://governor.nebraska.gov/press/gov-ricketts-announces-new-directed-health-measures-take-effect-saturday Further eased to 75 pct and no 10,000 person limit on 20201224:  https://governor.nebraska.gov/press/gov-ricketts-announces-new-directed-health-measures-take-effect-thursday Ends on 20210130: http://dhhs.ne.gov/Documents/SHHD-DHM-January.pdf
